job description:
Title: Senior Information Scientist

Location: US-NJ-Whippany

Job Number: 18208683

CTG's premier global client in Whippany, NJ, has an assignment for a Senior Information Scientist.

Major responsibilities of this position are:
  • Retrieve and analyze high quality data from commercial medical, science and business online and web-based databases for a diverse internal customer base as well as the client?s legal department with unique and complex information requirements
  • Provide critical information with a direct influence on the client?s R&D business decisions
  • Handle confidential information requests within strict timelines and interact with key decision makers and upper management in local and global groups
  • Identify, evaluate, and implement new information sources, databases, applications and techniques with focus on text and data mining for the client?s project leaders and management
  • Analyze site information training needs and direct the development and implementation of all end-user training programs needed to teach users how to search a variety of complex desktop electronic resources; design and prepare all instructional materials for end-users
  • Manage end-user electronic database services, new database product trials and product implementation library information systems collection management services and proprietary information services
  • Partner with vendors/suppliers to customize solutions and programs for database access and use in computer network environment
  • Serve as information management consultant to departments seeking solutions for optimum ways of monitoring scientific literature, real-time news, and for determining best database sources to meet their critical information needs
  • Monitor current developments in information science and technology and/or other subject specialties and pursue a program of personal/professional development to improve skills in these areas
  • Develop strong partnerships with internal customers to ensure an understanding of their business goals and scientific objectives
  • Determine how published and proprietary information projects relate to client's vision
  • Participate in and take senior role in site and international cross-functional teams
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in biomedical life sciences (Pharmacology/Biology/Medicine) with a minimum 7-10 years of professional information analysis experience using advanced analysis including text mining databases and analysis vocabularies; or Master's degree in library/information science or biomedical life sciences with a minimum 5-8 years of relevant experience; or PharmD in subject specialty with a minimum 1-3 years recent experience in the field of professional information analysis in life science industry using advanced analysis technologies using databases and controlled vocabularies/thesauri
  • Detailed knowledge and understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and pharmaceutical and corporate information services
  • In-depth advanced experience searching and evaluating commercial medical, science and/or business online and web-based databases and advanced working knowledge of library systems, acquisitions, and cataloging systems
  • Advanced experience writing programs, configuring and designing record formats in automated library systems
  • Experience in the field of information analysis using databases and controlled vocabularies
  • Excellent analytical/technical knowledge
  • High degree of confidentiality, flexibility, initiative, and ability to work under pressure
  • Excellent communication, presentation, problem solving, and organizational skills
  • Demonstrate supervisory and team-leadership skills
This position pays on a W2 hourly basis (no C2C or 1099's).

APPLY NOW for resume review by recruiter Pam Gewin!
